intro: Laplacea curtyana, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Laplacea curtyana thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests.
